h3.div: Governor Doug Ducey and Superintendent Kathy Hoffman announced a statewide closure of Arizona schools from March 16 through end of school year. Open Letter

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

h3.div: Palo Verde Elementary has been awarded a letter grade of "B" by the state of Arizona. Thank you to all our staff, students, parents, and community members! Your support makes this possible.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Tuesday through Friday 7:50 to 3:45
Late Buses for afterschool activities will run each Tuesday, Wednesday & Thursday at 4:55

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

h3.div: We asked: What is the best thing about Palo Verde School?

div.data-code:
I love how they maintain a close relationship with the community. They truly care about their students and their education. The teachers and staff at this school are amazing! I can't imagine sending my child to any other school. I do not agree with the funding cuts.

Staff

The staff maintains adequate communication with parents.

How will my taxes change if I vote yes? The relaxed family atmosphere.

A strong sense of community. The teachers and staff really care about the students and the school.

Staff and students are awesome.

Great teachers and staff who uphold the traditional values that make Palo Verde School such a wonderful school!

Children are always our first. The staff truly

Loves the kids and that shows

Old school values and an AMAZING staff!

The people. The staff and teachers are great. I like the small school/ community as well.

It’s like family

Teachers are great with the kids.

Friendly staff

The people and the service they give. The teachers and staff all know my children and take great care of them.

It's like FAMILY!

The teachers/staff really look out for the kids and make them feel safe.

The amount of support students get as well as the small town atmosphere and how tight knit the campus is.

What is the best thing about Palo Verde School? (continued)

The small population makes a personal feel at the school and a sense of ownership and responsibility. The teachers and curriculum are high quality and the team feel really comes through. Keep it going!

Sus valores, The values

The friendliness of the students and the faculty/staff.

Small community school with great teachers

The Teachers & Staff & how hard we work with our kids to make their lives with learning easier for them. The more hands on deck the better.

The students!

The Family like atmosphere. A small town feeling.

Having the same dedicated teachers

es una excelente escuela, It is an excellent school

Small campus, small classes

Teachers

The teachers and staff.

The best thing about Palo Verde School is that it is a small school with great teachers and staff! This school is like a second family to myself and my children.

What is the best thing about Palo Verde School? (continued)

The warm and family type environment

The best thing about Palo Verde School are the outstanding teachers that make lasting, positive impacts on students. Teachers like Robert Aldridge, Dana Gaskin, Alex Ramirez, and Terry Lanford made my years at Palo Verde Elementary memorable. This is also why I look forward to my son beginning his educational journey here in a few years.

Que les dan buena ensenansa alos estudiantes Students receive good teaching

the great effort put in by all staff

the people. the small feel. the traditions.

Teachers, staff that truly care for students, during and out of school. A tight knit community that is always willing to help any little bit and any where they can. Thank you PVES for keeping our kids safe, teaching them with patience, and guiding their life decisions with good manners and strong willingness.

Great teachers and staff!

Putting kids first

Our small town feel and that our kids always come first.

What is the best thing about Palo Verde School? (continued)

It’s not part of Buckeye Elementary School District.

Loyal Teachers

Discipline

The best thing about Palo Verde School is the teachers and staff who have a genuine desire to provide the best learning experience for the students. Teachers like Dana Gaskin and Terry Lanford, to name only a few, are the rare kind that make a positive impact on students that lasts a lifetime.

The staff

Smaller school

Great Staff!

My kids are happy and they are learning what they should.

The loving climate

Everyone here is amazing!

What is the best thing about Palo Verde School? (continued)

·La educación que le proveen a mis hijos y su entorno, ya que no es una escuela saturada de niños, agradezco a los maestros y a todo el personal de la escuela por su compromiso y dedicación. The education they provide to my children and their environment, since it is not a school saturated with children, I thank the teachers and all the school staff for their commitment and dedication.

The teachers and staff

Everything

Small school

Los maestros The teachers

Senior teachers in PVS

Palo Verde doesn't just teach academic, when your child leaves Palo Verde they will leave a better person. Respectful, considerate, helpful, driven, qualities that cannot be taught from a book. These are qualities the teachers that go the extra step will teach.

devotion to the students success

The history of the school and its a great big family.

Que una excelente escuela That it is an excellent school

What is the best thing about Palo Verde School? (continued)

The small school feeling it still has, I hope it never loses that.

Great teachers.

Su personal Personnel

Great teachers and staff who help the kids succeed!

Working together as a team we make it a "B" school!

Small classes, teachers(everyone but dewey) and faculty, the learning experience

It a small school district So with that said kids get more time to learn.

faculty seems genuinely motivated to help each other out

What is the best thing about Palo Verde School? (continued)

The teachers and the sense of community.

we work together like family and is a great place to work.

The small town atmosphere.

Community environment that promotes happy students

h2.div: Thank you for believing in us.

div.data-code:
Average salary of all teachers employed in FY 2020 (budget year) $52,780
Average salary of all teachers employed in FY 2019 (prior year) $50,249
Increase in average teacher salary from the prior year $2,531
Percentage increase  5%
Average teacher salaries computed on base salary only. Does not include Prop 301 Classroom Site Fund Base or Performance pay, which varies from year to year. Does not include supplemental contracts or extra duty pay.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Welcome to the website of Palo Verde Elementary School District. We hope you'll take some time to browse through our site and find out more about our district and what we have to offer our students, employees, and our community. If you have questions, we hope you'll contact us directly.

Whether you need to know about student registration, employment opportunities, calendar events, or just want to know what's for lunch, we're sure our website will provide you with the information you need. So, thanks for visiting Palo Verde Elementary School District, and enjoy your stay!

ul.li: Giving More Back to the Community! Fry's is committed to helping our communities grow and prosper. Year after year, local schools, churches, synagogues and other nonprofit organizations will earn millions of dollars through Fry's ...

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

div.p: Would you like to take $400 off of your state income tax and help Palo Verde School at the same time? A.R.S. 43-1089.01 allows taxpayers to receive up to $400 tax credit by contributing to one of Palo Verde School's extracurricular activities. This tax credit allows any taxpayer (parent and non-parent) to take a $400 credit before paying Arizona State Income Tax while supporting school activities.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Notification is required to inform building occupants at least once each school year about inspections, response actions, and post-response action activities, including periodic re-inspection and surveillance activities that are planned or in progress at each school K-12 in accordance with AHERA. The EPA requires every school to have an asbestos management plan

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

div.p: You may opt out of district and news media coverage or directory information releases by completing an Opt Out form and submitting it to the school office within the first two weeks of school or enrollment, whichever is later. Available here: Designation of Directory Information

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-ibL1re purZT-AhqUyc-ibL1re pSzOP-AhqUyc-ibL1re jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-ibL1re purZT-AhqUyc-ibL1re pSzOP-AhqUyc-ibL1re jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Superintendent, Robert Aldridge

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-EehZO jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Welcome to the website of Palo Verde Elementary School, home of the Eagles. Our website allows you to gain information and stay updated about the events taking place at Palo Verde School. It also provides a method for teachers and administrators to share some of the exciting events that are part of our educational programs. Please join us as often as possible on the website or at one of our events to get a first hand experience of "Eagle Pride."

I feel honored to serve as superintendent/principal of Palo Verde Elementary School because we have a dedicated staff and great kids! We are committed to providing a positive learning environment where children become self-directed learners, risk-takers, and responsible, respectful citizens.

We are looking forward to working with you and your children this year. It is our belief that the school-home partnership must be strong for your child to succeed in school. I invite you to become active, supportive partners in the education of your children.
One very important and practical way we can work together is for all of us to do everything we can to ensure good school attendance. Attendance every day is vital to children's learning.
If you have any questions, please feel free to call or visit our school.
Sincerely,
Robert Aldridge
Superintendent/Principal
